attributes.summary: Having low levels of Vitamin D can affect your tetosterone levels.
attributes.reasoning: Testosterone is essential for your health and wellbeing. It is responsible for maintaining sex drive, muscle strength and production of blood cells. Taking vitamin D supplements may increase testosterone levels.

attributes.summary: Diabetes causes inflammation in the body which is linked to an increase risk of heart disease. You can track inflammation with an Hs-CRP blood test.
attributes.reasoning: This test should not be used if you suffer from any inflammatory conditions, such as arthritis or inflammatory bowel disease. This will make the results elevated, and therefore they can not be accurately interpreted.

attributes.summary: A poor diet high in processed sugary foods can lead to diabetes.
attributes.reasoning: HbA1c measures your average blood sugar over the past three months and indicates your risk for diabetes.

attributes.summary: Low levels of Vitamin D are linked to thyroid related health problems.
attributes.reasoning: Ensuring you have enough of Vitamin D helps to improve thyroid function, as well as keeping your bones healthy and supporting your immune system.

attributes.summary: A poor diet can is linked to a number of health conditions including heart disease and some cancers. Inflammation is regulated by the balance of Omega 3 and Omega 6 fatty acids in your diet.
attributes.reasoning: High levels of Omega 3 reduce inflammation and reduce the risk of heart disease, whereas high levels of Omega 6 increase inflammation. A blood test allows you to check Omega 6 to Omega 3 ratio, and monitor your risk.

attributes.name: Effect of vitamin D supplementation on testosterone levels in men.
